isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - SPRING LEAF SUSPENSIONS- U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2 SERIES

svcproc.title: SPRING LEAF SUSPENSIONS- U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2 SERIES

note.para: Lubricate the leaf spring eye pin. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Place a block of wood on top of the spring assembly, then use a pry bar to lift the spring bracket and frame. Inspect the spring eye bushing for excessive wear ( Figure 29).

note.para: Movement of 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) or more indicates either: (1) that the spring eye pin and bushing should be replaced, or (2) that a broken spring eye and spring is connected to the spring bracket through the wrapper eye of the second leaf. In the case of (2), replace the complete spring.

warning.para: Use care when applying these techniques so that personal safety is not jeopardized.

step1.para: For drawkey spring brackets: Inspect the pin hole in the outboard leg of the bracket for excessive wear or hole elongation.

caution.para: Excessive wear or hole elongation may cause failure of the bracket pin, separation of components, and vehicle failure.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Spring Rear Bracket
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the the cam surface for excessive wear due to high mileage. Also inspect the outside legs for excessive wear caused by worn spring eye bushings.
Replace the bracket if it has excessive wear.

note.para: Leaf spring suspension systems with extended leaf springs (UE, RTE, and RTE2 Series) require a minimum clearance of 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) between the cam surface of the rear spring rear bracket and the top of the main leaf extension when the vehicle is not loaded. Refer to Figure 5.
If this clearance is less than 3/8 inch (9.5 mm), the spring leaf will not perform well when the vehicle is not loaded.

step1.para: Inspect the cam surface for wear. Excessive wear will reduce the clearance of the rear spring rear bracket. Refer to NOTE above ( Figure 30).

calloutgroup.callout1: 3.GRADE 8 BOLTS (LUBRICATE ALL THREADS WITH S.A.E. 20 OIL BEFORE ASSEMBLY)
4.GRADE C LOCKNUTS (LUBRICATE ALL THREADS WITH S.A.E. 20 OIL BEFORE ASSEMBLY)
5.MINIMUM OF 2 FULL THREADS MUST EXTEND BEYOND THE END OF THE NUT AFTER THE BOLT IS TIGHTENED TO THE VALUE FOUND IN THE TORQUE CHART

svcsubproc.title: Saddle Cap Fasteners
svcsubproc.para: Tighten the locknuts to the values shown in the TORQUE CHART, to prevent wear of the beam center bushing into the saddle.

svcsubproc.title: Spring Assembly
svcsubproc.para: Inspect all leaves and spring clips for cracks or damage. On high-mileage vehicles with one or more leaves broken, replace the spring assembly on both sides to assure even spring deflection.
